title: New Noxus lore lads! Get hyped!

embed.description: Noxus is a powerful empire with a fearsome reputation. To those beyond its borders, Noxus is brutal, expansionist and threatening, yet those who look beyond its warlike exterior see an unusually inclusive society, where the strengths and talents of its people are respected and cultivated.

New biography, new concept arts new description but sill not Swain's lore :(

replies.body:
Swain's lore is bloody perfect.

Not only does it nail down his personality and overall theme but also provides us with so much information regarding his rise to power, the regime before him, and of course...The Black Rose.

It gives off a very "Game of Thrones" vibe, with the game Jericho is always playing against Evaine and I'm anxious to see what Riot has in store in terms of future stories!

Them not going into detail of how Swain even managed to subdue the demon is a nice touch since it still keeps up the shroud of mystery regarding Swain.


I cannot stress enough how relatable, human, and frankly, awesome, Jericho is portrayed, he's really shaping up to be one of my favorite characters in the Lore.

10/10
Only this, and nothing more...or less for that matter!

From Aurelion Sol's color story, Twin Dawns: https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/aurelionsol-color-story/

So there's a lot for me to both take in and comment on, and I say this from the perspective of someone who has basically waited for this moment for more or less 8 years.

This is becoming a lot less known today, but LoL's original write-ups for both Noxus and Demacia were actually pretty morally ambiguous in someways. And I know it surprises some people now, but they were both meant to be 'grey' in different ways. You'd have to use the WaybackMachine to find the old pages for the factions, but yeah, to me finally I start to see that meritocratic free community Noxus was supposed to be (although they were also described as xenophobic back then which made no sense even back then).

Anyway, so it did give this old-lore fart a kick to see a reference to the Fleshing. Ah, nice to see some barbaric traditions are still around in reworked Noxus, heh. Could we see an {{champion:12}} or {{champion:5}} story update in future in relation to their experiences in the Fleshing?

{{champion:7}} turning out to have orchestrated the _actual creation of the Noxus empire_ after disposing of Mordekaiser ? Interesting so in a sense that would make the sort-of...**Mother of Noxus** in some sense. I didn't expect her to be _that_ entrenched in Noxus' history, intriguing! Also makes me wonder if she had a hand in the creation of other nations.

Also now she could be the sugarmommy to {{champion:50}} ? Naice. Though somehow I don't expect it to be as straightfoward as, she's literally a centuries old woman. Maybe women. Hms.

I kinda laughed at how she's all covered up (_LeBurqa _), but I can see  the practicality of it - I mean, she definitely need a VGU eventually and now you don't have to ever come back to rewrite how she looks in the stories! Also in-story, she could use any kind of proxy and noone would know while she remotely controls and monitors everything from some basement (_NeckBlanc_!)

I think there's still parts of Swain's history that's not shown to us yet, such as the actual moment/encounter he has with the demon presumably down in the Halls of the Dead. Will that be in the form of additional stories, a comic, or being left as ambiguous for now?

There's also this disconnect I feel with regards to how the knowledge of his powers doesn't seem as well-known as you'd think? I mean, in the dev diary, when they spoke about how 'magic is another tool', we pan on a shot of Swain displaying his arm. But in the stories, we're actually shown that he makes a conscious effort to conceal it until the right time, or that it's very much not commonly known. Not all his generals knew for example, and in the Ironspike Mountains, they heard of his injuries from Ionia but not of his recovery or his newfound powers.

How exactly does Swain wield his powers on the battlefield in this case? It seemed the practical thing would be for him to go ahead and lead the battles, but apparently this is not the case. Rank-and-file soldiers would gossip and spread such tales as their Grand General being able to shoot red lightning, and having wings. But again, this doesn't seem to be the actual case. Could a Rioter shed some light on this?

Some friends I've discussed with are kinda disappointed at {{champion:91}} 's complete absence from updates, is there anything planned for him to be part of the overarching story that seems to include other Noxians (even Urgot)?

Overall, great to see the updates, and even if its greedy, I hope there's more to come as well. Thanks!

I think the point of swain powers is that his ability to personally destroy you is actually secondary to his ability to gather information in terms of usefulness. Most of the soldiers don't even know that he might actually be more personally powerful than someone like Darius. 

I imagine that swain spends more time listening to his ravens and making tactical decisions based on their reports than zapping people with force lightning,
